item.title: Titanic Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description:
Compared various variables to survival outcome for passengers aboard the Titanic by creating graphics in R

Created a basic website to assist my Order of the Arrow Chapter

item.title: Comparing Greenhouse Emission Levels by State
item.description:
Utilizing data from the EPA website the compare CO2, NOx, and CH4 emissions by state

  • view in tableau public

item.title: Item without image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Name of the work 5
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description:
R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.

You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)
##      speed           dist       
##  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
##  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
##  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
##  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
##  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
##  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
fit <- lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
fit
## 
## Call:
## lm(formula = dist ~ speed, data = cars)
## 
## Coefficients:
## (Intercept)        speed  
##     -17.579        3.932

Including Plots

You can also embed plots. See Figure 1 for example:
